Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more
HTML:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY

  • Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
  • Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
  • Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
  • Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
  • Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
  • A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
  • Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
  • Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
  • Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
  • Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • 🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • 💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • 🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • 💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • 🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • 🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • 👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • 🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst, Aftermarket
Description:
Data Analyst Aftermarket
Bydgoszcz, Poland
SPX Flow – Globally And Locally
SPX FLOW, Inc. manufactures and supplies engineered flow components, process equipment, and turn-key systems. The Company offers 20 brands of pumps, valves, mixes, air dryers, hydraulic tools, homogenizers, separators, and heat exchangers, filtration solutions as well as aftermarket parts and services.
SPX FLOW serves food and beverage, health, and industrial manufacturers, bringing together trusted brands and technologies to meet new consumer expectations and anticipate industry trends. Many of your household goods & favorite snacks may have been created with the help of SPX Flow solutions.
SPX Flow has been established for over 100 years! Headquartered in North Carolina, we have operations in more than 25 countries and a broad global customer base. Our 5000 employees worldwide innovate to design, deliver and service high-value solutions for our customers.
As a world leader in sustainable solutions, we’ve launched projects at our facilities to save energy and reduce waste, and we engineer efficiency into our products and technologies to help our customers do the same. We currently hold more than 550 patents worldwide, and roughly 44% of them are related to sustainability and clean technology.
SPX flow at Bydgoszcz, Poland is looking for Data Analyst
About The Role
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for data analysis, problem-solving, and a desire to make an impact within our organization. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our managers to support the collection, processing, and analysis of data to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions.
About Your Responsibilities At SPX Flow

Gathering, cleaning, and organizing large sets of data from various internal sources
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key business metrics
Define, implement, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess Aftermarket and Supply Chain performance
Conduct basic statistical analysis to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and business needs
Generate ad-hoc reports and insights based on business requests
Help improve data collection processes and ensure data integrity
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data analysis
Be involved in internal data projects with company wide impact

About You

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience in a related role within an industrial or manufacturing environment
Proficiency in Excel experience with SQL is a plus
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Proficiency with SAP 5&6 / HANA
MS Office knowledge mandatory
Knowledge of basic statistical methods and techniques, Lean Six Sigma qualification is a plus
Very good English skills in spoken and written (business fluent)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new tools and technologies
Know how within Incident-, Problem- and Change Management
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

About Your Benefits

Performance & recognition programs.
Bonus structures (depending on company and personal performance).
Family friendly policies.
Genuine progression and development opportunities with a global organization.
Healthy minds and healthy lives resources.
Retirement savings plans with company contributions.

About The Company Globally
At SPX FLOW, sustainability is more than a buzzword. It’s a way forward. We improve the world through innovative, sustainable solutions. 
Check out our sustainable solutions here: here
We put people first, creating opportunities for everyone, and we give back to our communities too. Our team members are what make SPX FLOW special.
Next steps?
Does it sound as your next job? Be our solution in the making and apply now!
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Power BI & Finance Data)

Location: Spain, Fully Remote - Spanish & UK Residents accepted

Start Date: January 2026

Duration: 12+ Months

Rate: £45/50 per hour

Language: English; Spanish is a nice to have




Key Responsibilities:

Analysis & Financial Insights: Conduct in-depth analysis of financial data (sales, revenue, profit, sustainability) to assess dealer performance and identify areas for improvement.
Data Modeling & Transformation: Leverage Power BI and other tools to transform and model complex data from various financial systems, primarily Snowflake/SQL, into actionable insights.
Customer Interaction & Relationship Building: Actively engage with business partners to gather requirements, understand business needs, and translate them into technical solutions. Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment and delivery of high-value insights.
BI Solutions Development: Develop and maintain robust Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, with a focus on financial metrics and visual reporting. This includes working on data flows, data models, and dynamic reporting dashboards using Power BI.
Collaboration & Agile Development: Work in Agile teams alongside colleagues in Spain and India to design and implement data solutions with high criticality and complex data models.
Proactive Problem Solving: Identify areas for process improvement, propose solutions, and be an active go-getter in driving value for the business.




Skills & Experience Required:

BI & Power Platform Expertise: At least 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence solutions, specifically with Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate. Expertise in Power Query (M language), DAX, data modeling, and dynamic Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI.
Financial Data Analysis: Strong experience in analyzing financial data such as sales, revenue, profit, and sustainability metrics. Ability to work with financial indicators and assess financial health.
Data Engineering & ETL Processes: Experience with ETL processes, data warehouses (Snowflake), and integration of data from various sources (ERP, CRM, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Data Modeling & Data Flows: Proficiency in designing and building data models, transforming raw data into clean, structured, and insightful datasets for reporting.
Business Analysis: Ability to work with business teams to identify and define statistical indicators, metrics, and ratios for business needs, ensuring that the data aligns with business goals.
Collaboration & Communication: Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven experience in gathering requirements and translating them into technical specifications.
Agile Methodologies: Experience working within Agile teams, with a strong focus on delivering high-quality, customized BI solutions.
Proactive & Independent: A proactive, self-driven attitude with the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks and responsibilities.




Key Tools & Technologies:

Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Data Modeling, Visuals)
Power Apps & Power Automate
Snowflake (Data Warehousing, ETL)
SQL, MySQL (Data Sources)
ERP, CRM Systems (Data Integration)
Agile Development Methodologies




Desirable Traits:

Customer-Focused: Ability to maintain ongoing communication with clients, ensuring solutions meet their requirements.
Proactive Approach: Ability to take initiative, propose solutions, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-Oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on delivering high-quality results.




Working Environment:

Fully remote role, but preference for candidates based in Spain, Portugal, or the UK.
Collaborative environment with team members based in The UK, Spain and India.
Agile work environment with an emphasis on critical, high-impact solutions.




This role is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst with a strong financial background and BI solution expertise, offering the chance to make a significant impact within a dynamic, international team.

If you are available and interested in this opportunity, please apply for further information.

Please note due to high volumes of applications we are unable to contact every application. If you do not hear back from us within 7 days of sending your application, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion.

At Lucid, we celebrate difference and value diverse perspectives, underpinned by our values ‘Honesty, Integrity and Pragmatism’. We are proud to provide equal opportunities in line with our Diversity and Inclusion policy and welcome applications from all suitably qualified or experienced people, regardless of personal characteristics. If you have a disability or health condition and seek support throughout the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact us via the details below.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst Medior con experiencia en entornos de Business Intelligence sobre Azure para participar en un proyecto de visualización y análisis de datos estratégicos, dentro de un entorno cloud moderno.




Responsabilidades




Analizar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes en entornos cloud.
Desarrollar dashboards y reportes en Power BI Premium.
Crear modelos analíticos en Azure Analysis Services.
Desarrollar y mantener consultas SQL optimizadas.
Colaborar con equipos de producto y negocio para transformar datos en insights.




Requisitos




+3 años de experiencia como Data Analyst.
Dominio de Power BI, SQL, y Azure Analysis Services.
Conocimiento de herramientas como Visual Studio y GitHub.
Experiencia en proyectos de Business Intelligence.
Inglés fluido.




Además, en K-LAGAN queremos que disfrutes de la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




✅ Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable

🏢 Modalidad: Híbrido en Barcelona (2 días en oficina - 3 desde casa)

📈 Seguimiento técnico y acompañamiento

🎓 Formación continua

🎂 Día libre en tu cumpleaños

🎉 Eventos, team buildings y más




Si te apasiona dar sentido a los datos y ayudar a tomar decisiones estratégicas con ellos, ¡este proyecto es para ti! 🚀




¡Aplica ahora y hagamos que los datos cuenten!

Title: Data Analist | Power BI
Description:
Voor een klant binnen de online entertainment sector ben ik momenteel op zoek naar een ervaren data analist. Het bedrijf bestaat vandaag iets langer dan 3 jaar en kan al een sterke groei neerleggen.




Je zal instaan voor de technische implementatie van nieuwe data visualisatie tools. Daarna neem je een trekkende rol om analyses en rapportages op te zetten die een impact zullen maken op de strategische beslissingen van het bedrijf.




Heb je vandaag al een eerste ervaring als data analist en kijk je naar een nieuwe uitdaging waar jouw input van belang is? Solliciteer dan zeker voor meer informatie!




Hoe zal jouw takenpakket eruit zien?

Je ontwerpt en bouwt dashboards in Power BI en Looker Studio.
Je brengt operationele KPI’s in kaart en volgt deze nauwgezet op.
Je levert strategische rapportages over onder andere promoties, gebruikersgedrag en interne processen.
Je analyseert de impact van wijzigingen of voorstellen en ondersteunt bij datagedreven beslissingen.
Je signaleert nieuwe kansen in data en vertaalt deze naar concrete acties.




Wat verwachten wij van jou?

Je hebt minstens 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analyst of in een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent expert in Power BI en hebt ervaring met Looker Studio.
Je beschikt over sterke kennis van datawarehouse-systemen, datamodellering en ETL-processen.
Je denkt analytisch en strategisch, stelt kritische vragen en kijkt vooruit.
Je beheerst de Engelse taal uitstekend, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een marktconform salaris tussen €3.500 en €5.500 volgens jouw ervaring.
Een impactvolle functie binnen een jonge, digitale en snelgroeiende organisatie.
De ruimte om eigen analyses te ontwikkelen en daadwerkelijk impact te maken.
Heel wat flexibiliteit om een optimale work-life balans te verkrijgen. Zo kan je rekenen op heel wat thuiswerk en flexibele werkuren.
Je krijgt een enorme portie autonomie in deze functie. Je zal de data divisie opstarten en inrichten volgens jouw visie.

Bekijk zeker ook onze website voor meer vacatures in IT: https://jobs.kwery.be/

Show more

  • Heel wat flexibiliteit om een optimale work-life balans te verkrijgen. Zo kan je rekenen op heel wat thuiswerk en flexibele werkuren.
  • Je krijgt een enorme portie autonomie in deze functie. Je zal de data divisie opstarten en inrichten volgens jouw visie.

Bekijk zeker ook onze website voor meer vacatures in IT: https://jobs.kwery.be/

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau and SQL (Hybrid - Madrid)
Description:
🚀 We are still looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




🔎 What we look for?

We are looking for a Data Business Analyst with at least 3 years of experience to join the Data Visualization Competence Center with Tableau and SQL skills to support the transition to a new data platform of our client from the banking sector.




High english level is required.




Availability to go to the client's offices in the centre of Madrid 3 days a week.




⚙ Key Responsibilities:

Analyse the current BI landscape, understand business needs, and identify gaps between the legacy and future data environments.
Read, interpret, troubleshoot, and eventually build or enhance Tableau reports, and work hands-on with SQL to validate and explore data as part of your analysis..
Building dashboards.




💡 Mandatory requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related discipline 3+ years in a data/BI/business analyst or similar role
Solid hands-on experience with Tableau and SQL
Ability to conduct gap analysis and map current vs future state in data/reporting environments
Skilled in creating clear, structured documentation
Ability to understand and communicate data/reporting-related changes and its business impact
Ability to translate technical findings into clear, business-friendly insights Data analysis and problem solving skills
Exceptional communication skills to interact with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiples tasks and prioritize effectively
Proactive, collaborative, and customer-focused approach to solving problems
English at least B2+/C1




💰 ¿What can we offer?

-✈️ 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!

-❤️ Numerous benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).

-🍴 `Retribución Flexible´ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Heath Care Plan…)

-🎓 Free access to several training platforms

-🚀 Professional stability and career plans

-🚶 UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.

-🔗 The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.

-🏡 Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime…)

-🎁 UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




📧 If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details. UST is waiting for you!




In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality. We have a special commitment to Disability & Inclusion, so we are interested in hiring people with disability certificate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At SpotOn, we’re helping restaurants and small businesses compete and win with flexible payment and software technology—backed by real people who really care. From seamless point-of-sale systems to integrated restaurant management solutions, every SpotOn tool is designed to help local businesses increase profits and create better experiences for their customers and employees.  

Recently, SpotOn was:

Named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies of 2024
Awarded Great Places to Work and Built In’s Best Workplaces for the third year in a row
Selected as the Best Overall Restaurant POS by NerdWallet 
Rated the top-rated point-of-sale (POS) for restaurants, bars, retail, and small businesses by Capterra users

We’re committed to caring hard and moving fast so that we can continue to grow and make a positive impact together. 

That’s where you come in. 

On a daily basis, you will:

Analytics Genius: Serve up impactful data-backed recs with a focus on predictive modeling and statistical analysis driving strategic decisions and business growth.
Data Transformation: Identify relevant data sources, validate/reconcile data, and build concise and future-proof models designed for adaptability and scalability.
Automation Mastermind: Get to the bottom of data discrepancies and outdated manual processes to ensure smooth operations using machine learning and data pipelines.
Churn Crusader: Dive deep into why merchants are churning, figure out "what happened," and use those insights to help us improve, employing advanced segmentation and predictive analytics.
Understanding causality: Partner with our customer support team to understand the customer sentiment. The goal is to be able to link past interactions during onboarding, past go-live and using our software features to retention and upsell successes.
Team Up: Collaborate with Finance, Operations, Sales, and Product teams to maintain a reliable data infrastructure and contribute to data science initiatives.

What You'll Bring:

5 years of experience in data science, business analytics, payments, finance, statistics, or a related field.
Willing to come into our Kraków office 2-3 times per week.
Strong SQL skills (ability to write complex queries to extract insights), experience with BI tools, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R.
Operating with a bias toward sharing, transparency and collaboration is your default!
Diving in, solving problems, and getting things done is second nature - no waiting for perfect conditions.
Thriving in fast-paced environments, embracing ambiguity, and taking initiative without a rulebook.

Perfect candidate also has: 

Experience in accounting, finance, or SaaS.
Flexibility with working hours, ideally availability from 1 PM to 9 PM.

Here’s a bit about what we have to offer:

Competitive pay: 11000 - 15500 PLN gross on CoE.
Training budget 3500 PLN gross per year.
Access to e-learning platforms (O’Reilly).
Fully paid private healthcare in LuxMed.
Access to the Worksmile platform with a monthly top-up.
Company free breakfasts/lunches in the office once a week.
Group English classes with a native speaker.
Dell Latitude and whatever tools you need.
New, modern, bright and comfortable office space in the city centre.
A lot of free parking spots around the office.
Access to the company’s library.
Great working atmosphere.
Chill out room with a PlayStation and games.
Free snacks and beverages in a kitchen.
Company parties and social activities.
Employee referral program.
Relocation Package within Poland.

 

 

The controller of your personal data included in your job offer and others collected during the recruitment process is SpotOn Poland spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością with its registered office in Kraków, Aleja 29 listopada 20, 31-401 Kraków, e-mail address:
poland-rodo@spoton.com. We will process your personal data for the purpose of current or, if you voluntarily agree, also future recruitment processes. More information about how we proccess your data, including the basis for processing and your rights in relation to the processing, can be found on our website: https://pl.spoton.com/privacy-and-cookies-policy.


Administratorem podanych danych osobowych, w tym danych zawartych w dokumentach aplikacyjnych i zebranych w toku procesu rekrutacji, jest SpotOn Poland Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Krakowie (ul. Aleja 29 listopada 20, 31-401 Kraków; adres e-mail do kontaktu:
poland-rodo@spoton.com. Dane osobowe będą przetwarzane w celu realizacji obecnych lub – jeżeli wyrazisz na to dobrowolną zgodę – także przyszłych procesów rekrutacji. Więcej informacji o tym, jak przetwarzamy Twoje dane, w tym także informacje o podstawach prawnych przetwarzania oraz o prawach przysługujących Ci w związku z przetwarzaniem danych, znajdziesz na stronie:
https://pl.spoton.com/privacy-and-cookies-policy.

SpotOn is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

SpotOn is an e-verify company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Te apasiona el BigData? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias más solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¿Te apetece trabajar en una compañía joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¡SÍ!

En Mática Partners, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnológica, y además somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Analyst con 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos para generar insights accionables y apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en data.




¿Qué buscamos?




2 años o más de experiencia con Power Bi.
Experiencia demostrada en DAX (cálculos de medida complejas).
Conocimientos en PowerQuery / M para transformación de datos.
Solidos conocimientos en modelado de datos.
Habilidad en diseño de dashboards atractivos y user-friendly.
Experiencia en manejo de parámetros, slicers avanzados, bookmarks, navegación dinámica.
Experiencia demostrada en conexión a diversas fuentes de datos (Excel, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Comunicación fluida con usuarios de negocio.
Se valorará experiencia en Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Virtual Agents, Dataverse)
Alto nivel de inglés. Te integrarás en un equipo internacional y tu nivel de inglés debe ser alto, tanto escrito como hablado.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y salario a valorar según experiencia, (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com




Do you want to be Mática?




Be Mática!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - EDG Steward - Data Quality/Governance
Description:
Description

Job ID 6517

Why Ness

We know that people are our greatest asset. Our staff’s professionalism, innovation, teamwork, and dedication to excellence have helped us become one of the world’s leading technology companies. It is these qualities that are vital to our continued success. As a Ness employee, you will be working on products and platforms for some of the most innovative software companies in the world.

You’ll gain knowledge working alongside other highly skilled professionals that will help accelerate your career progression.

You’ll also benefit from an array of advantages like access to trainings and certifications, bonuses, and aids, socializing activities and attractive compensation.

Requirements And Responsibilities

We are seeking a dedicated Data Analyst to serve as the EDG (Enterprise Data Governance) Steward focused on Data Quality (DQ) and Data Governance (DG). The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data across the organization, as well as supporting data governance initiatives.

What You’ll Do


Monitor and assess data quality metrics to identify and resolve data quality issues.
Collaborate with data stewards and business units to establish data governance standards and practices.
Conduct data profiling and analysis to ensure compliance with data governance policies.
Document data sources, data lineage, and metadata to support data governance efforts.
Provide training and support to staff on data quality and governance best practices.
Assist in the development of data quality and governance frameworks and policies.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data governance and quality.


What You’ll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience in data analysis and understanding of data governance principles.
Strong analytical skills and experience with data profiling tools.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Other Preferred Skills


Familiarity with data quality and governance tools and technologies.
Knowledge of SQL and data management practices.
Understanding of data lifecycle management and regulatory compliance.


Not checking every single requirement?

If this role sounds good to you, even if you don’t meet every single bullet point in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. For most of the candidates that applied, we found a role that was a very good fit with their skills.

Let’s meet and you may just be the right candidate for one of our roles.

At Ness Digital Engineering we are willing to build a work culture that is based on diversification, inclusion, and authenticity

HTML:
Description

Job ID 6517

Why Ness

We know that people are our greatest asset. Our staff’s professionalism, innovation, teamwork, and dedication to excellence have helped us become one of the world’s leading technology companies. It is these qualities that are vital to our continued success. As a Ness employee, you will be working on products and platforms for some of the most innovative software companies in the world.

You’ll gain knowledge working alongside other highly skilled professionals that will help accelerate your career progression.

You’ll also benefit from an array of advantages like access to trainings and certifications, bonuses, and aids, socializing activities and attractive compensation.

Requirements And Responsibilities

We are seeking a dedicated Data Analyst to serve as the EDG (Enterprise Data Governance) Steward focused on Data Quality (DQ) and Data Governance (DG). The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data across the organization, as well as supporting data governance initiatives.

What You’ll Do

  • Monitor and assess data quality metrics to identify and resolve data quality issues.
  • Collaborate with data stewards and business units to establish data governance standards and practices.
  • Conduct data profiling and analysis to ensure compliance with data governance policies.
  • Document data sources, data lineage, and metadata to support data governance efforts.
  • Provide training and support to staff on data quality and governance best practices.
  • Assist in the development of data quality and governance frameworks and policies.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data governance and quality.

What You’ll Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in data analysis and understanding of data governance principles.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data profiling tools.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Other Preferred Skills

  • Familiarity with data quality and governance tools and technologies.
  • Knowledge of SQL and data management practices.
  • Understanding of data lifecycle management and regulatory compliance.

Not checking every single requirement?

If this role sounds good to you, even if you don’t meet every single bullet point in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. For most of the candidates that applied, we found a role that was a very good fit with their skills.

Let’s meet and you may just be the right candidate for one of our roles.

At Ness Digital Engineering we are willing to build a work culture that is based on diversification, inclusion, and authenticity

Title: Working Student Interior Sensing ML (m/w/d)
Description:
Why join Aptiv? You'll have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge applications, develop breakthrough technologies, and deliver innovative solutions to some of the world’s leading automotive brands. See your work come to life on the road—helping make mobility safer, greener, and more connected. Ready to shape the future of mobility with us?

YOUR ROLE

As a Working Student in our team, you will contribute to the development of the next generation of AI algorithms for real-world automotive applications. You will work closely with our engineers on innovative in-cabin sensing solutions that enable vehicles to understand their environment and ensure passenger safety and comfort.

In your daily job you will:

Support us in topics related to machine learning in advanced engineering applications: data preparation and processing, data collection, neural network training and evaluation

YOUR BACKGROUND

Key skills and competencies for succeeding in this role are:


Currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar at German university
Proficient in Python programming
Practical experience with at least one machine learning framework, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Caffe, or fast.ai.
Strong English skills (German is a plus)
Motivated by challenging tasks and enjoys to be part of a team


WHY JOIN US?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


YOUR BENEFITS AT APTIV:


Paid hourly
Flexible working hours
Planned onboarding process
Attractive training and development plan
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment


APPLY TODAY, AND TOGETHER LET’S CHANGE TOMORROW!

Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Gerente Popeyes Madrid
Description:
**¡En Popeyes® necesitamos de tu talento!**

Si quieres contribuir a que nuestra receta Louisiana llegue a todas las partes de nuestro país, ¡ahora es tu oportunidad!

¿Te gustaría trabajar en un entorno dinámico con oportunidades reales de hacer carrera profesional? ¡Has encontrado tu lugar!

Buscamos **Gerentes** para nuestros restaurantes de **Madrid** y alrededores.


¿Qué necesitamos de ti?**
Experiencia como encargado/a preferiblemente en el sector de la restauración.
Valorables conocimientos de TPV, CAJA, MANEJO DE Office y ofimática en general a nivel de usuario.
Disponibilidad completa.
Estudios mínimos deseables: educación secundaria obligatoria.
Facilidad para desplazamiento a nuestro restaurante.
Habilidades para atender a nuestros/as clientes/as como nadie.
Trabajar en equipo con el talento de nuestras cocinas.
Ganas, ganas y más ganas de aprender, ¡nunca es suficiente!
¿Cómo será tu día a día en Popeyes®?**
Ventas y objetivos de la actividad: Seguimiento de objetivos de venta y operacionales del establecimiento. Serás el responsable de la gestión de la caja.
Gestión de los Recursos Humanos y del equipo: Ser el motor de motivación de tu equipo, liderarles, realizar turnos, comunicar altas y bajas, hacer un seguimiento de las incidencias, etc.
Atención al cliente: Gestión de quejas y reclamaciones con el fin de ofrecer el mejor servicio a nuestros/as clientes/as.
Marketing y promoción: Te asegurarás de tener los materiales promocionales y cumplir con la normativa corporativa.
PRL: Cumplir con la normativa y todas las medidas de prevención de riesgos laborales.
Tareas de reposición y control del stock del establecimiento.
Asegurar el correcto mantenimiento y limpieza del local.
¿Qué te ofrecemos a cambio?**
Plan de carrera: Posibilidad de realizarte en una gran empresa de restauración en plena expansión y desarrollo a nivel nacional. ¡Podrás llegar a gerente en poco más de un año si cumples con el plan estipulado y existe una vacante en alguno de nuestros establecimientos!
Modalidad de contrato: Indefinido con diferentes tipos de jornadas.
Horario: Turnos rotativos.
Salario: Según convenio.
Disfrutar de la Retribución Flexible de RB Europe (ticket restaurante, transporte, guardería, etc.), una plataforma llena de beneficios para que ahorres mensualmente. Beneficiarte de un pack de descuentos y experiencias solo por ser de RB Europe (descuentos de grupo y otras promociones).


En Popeyes® estamos comprometidos con la igualdad, y por ello promovemos ambientes de trabajo basados en el respeto a las personas, fomentando el desarrollo profesional de nuestros/as trabajadores/as garantizando en todo momento la igualdad de oportunidades. Nos preocupamos en ofrecer y mantener un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier forma de discriminación motivada por edad, género, orientación sexual, cultura, religión, etnia o cualquier otro motivo personal o social.

Si eres un/a auténtico/a fan de nuestro pollo® y quieres formar parte de un proyecto laboral retador, ¡no dudes más y envíanos tu solicitud!
Show more

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities:
• Provide expert technical support to partners, dealers, and enterprise customers for
CHCNAV products, including troubleshooting, installation guidance, and training.
• Conduct on-site/remote product demonstrations, tests, and training sessions across
Europe.
• Collaborate with sales teams as a technical expert to address customer inquiries and
support business growth.
• Analyze and resolve product-related issues, escalate bugs, and track enhancements
with CHCNAV (Shanghai).
• Develop and maintain training materials, user guides, and partner onboarding
resources.
• Connect with European GNSS agencies for certifications, technical documentation,
and partnerships.
• Monitor industry trends and competitor technologies to provide proactive support.

Qualifications & Skills:
• Bachelor’s/Master’s in Engineering (Surveying, GNSS, or related field).
• Technical support/customer service in hardware/software (GNSS or surveying
preferred).
• Public speaking and training delivery (technical audiences).
• Fluent in English + German (written/spoken)

Title: ASSISTANT(E) SOCIAL MEDIA & BRAND CONTENT
Description:
À propos

Favikon est la plateforme d'influence pour tous !

Fondée en 2019, Favikon permet à n'importe qui d'intégrer des influenceurs dans leur stratégie marketing, en leur permettant d'identifier, d'analyser et de tracker les influenceurs.

Avec un système de notes, Favikon élimine tous les risques potentiels liés aux partenariats avec des influenceurs, et le tout de manière ludique et fun ! 🥰

Descriptif du poste

Favikon est une startup qui croit énormément à la force du marketing ! L’équipe se développe très vite et les missions sont variées.

Tes Missions

Social Media 🌈


Créer du contenu pour les réseaux sociaux Favikon (Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, X, Youtube et Pinterest)
Prévoir le calendrier éditorial
Faire des visuels pour les différents réseaux sociaux
Mettre à jour le reporting mensuel


Blog 💻


Écriture des articles du blog pour optimiser le SEO
Mis en page des articles sur Webflow


Profil recherché

Compétences Requises


Tu es en 4ème ou 5ème année d’école de communication/marketing
L’ambition est ta première qualité et tu sais te montrer force de proposition dans une équipe à ton écoute
Tu as une forte appétence pour les réseaux sociaux et le marketing d’influence
Tu utilises déjà beaucoup l'IA
L’anglais est ta langue préférée, créer du contenu en anglais ne te fait pas peur
Tu aimes le travail en équipe, mais tu sais te montrer indépendant(e) et organisé(e)


Process de recrutement

💻 Premier entretien visio avec le Head of Marketing

💡 Cas pratique

😎 Entretien à WeWork avec Jérémy (CEO)

🎉 Onboarding avec l'équipe entière

Informations complémentaires


Type de contrat : Alternance (11 à 36 mois)
Date de début : 01 septembre 2025
Lieu : Paris
Niveau d'études : Bac +3
Expérience : > 6 mois
Télétravail partiel possible
Show more

Title: Data Engineer Senior (H/F)
HTML:
Apgar Consulting, fondée en 2013, est une société de conseil en Data de premier plan, reconnue par les analystes comme Gartner, qui accompagne ses clients dans leur parcours pour construire une base de données fiables.

De la sensibilisation des personnes aux changements organisationnels en passant par l'activation et le support technologiques, nous concevons et fournissons des solutions sur mesure qui fournissent des données de manière cohérente, sécurisée et précise.

Nous sommes des experts dans la Data Advisory, la Data Arcthitecture, la Data Academy et la Data for Green, ainsi que dans la mise en œuvre et le support de solutions de Platform Data telles que la Data Preparation, le Master Data Management, le Meta Data Management et la Data Integration.

Apgar Consulting agit pour les petites et grandes entreprises, en Europe, aux États-Unis et au Moyen-Orient.

Construit avec des valeurs fortes, Apgar Consulting a pour objectif de fournir des services de conseil durables.

L'innovation et le pragmatisme sont les clés de notre approche orientée Data.

Nous sommes une véritable entreprise centrée sur les personnes et axée sur les objectifs et nous offrons un environnement de développement personnel et de croissance de carrière avec une véritable conscience sociale.

Nous recrutons des profils Data et nous misons en priorité sur les Soft-Skills sachant que nous ne spécialisons pas nos talents sur des secteurs d'activité et que nous favorisons l'accompagnement et la montée en compétences.

POSTE / MISSIONS

En qualité de Data Engineer, vous travaillez au sein d'une équipe intervenant directement sur un projet client.

Vous gérez un projet en autonomie, de bout en bout, sous la supervision de votre

Directeur Projet Et Vos Mission Sont Les Suivantes

  • Assurer le rôle de Chef de projet de la mission et êtes garant de la qualité technique et fonctionnelle de la solution ;
  • Être l'interlocuteur privilégié du client ;
  • Participer au cadrage et au suivi du périmètre du projet (définition des hypothèses, estimation des charges, planification, organisation et définition de la méthodologie, reporting) ;
  • Assurer et veiller au recueil du besoin et à la rédaction des spécifications fonctionnelles et/ou techniques ainsi qu'aux tests internes de la solution ;
  • Animer les ateliers de conception fonctionnelles et rédigez les comptes-rendus ;
  • Accompagner le client dans la recette et le déploiement de la solution ;
  • Réaliser des activités d'avant-vente et réponse à des appels d'offres ;
  • Estimer le chiffrage des coûts d'implémentation et la planification du projet ;
  • Participer à la rédaction de la proposition commerciale.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

Profil Recherché

  • De formation Bac+5 minimum au sein d'une grande école d'ingénieur ou d'informatique, vous disposez de minimum 5 ans d'expérience sur ce type de fonction ;
  • Vous avez des appétences relationnelles, commerciales, managériales et êtes à même de gérer un projet dans sa globalité tant au niveau business, financier et qu'humain ;
  • Dynamique et enthousiaste, vous aimez le travail en équipe ;
  • Un niveau d'anglais opérationnel est requis ;

AVANTAGES

Package attractif (Fixe + Variable) selon profil + 75% Pass Navigo Mensuel + 2 jours de Télétravail par semaine + Mutuelle + Prévoyance + Intéressement

Title: Młodsza Specjalistka / Młodszy Specjalista w Departamencie Rachunkowości – Zespół Parametryzacji
Description:
VeloBank S.A.O firmie

ważna jeszcze 19 dni

(do 10 wrz)

ważna jeszcze 19 dni

(do 10 wrz)


Uniwersytecka 18, Katowice(śląskie)
umowa o pracę
część etatu
młodszy specjalista (Junior)
praca stacjonarna
rekrutacja zdalna


Siedziba firmy

Uniwersytecka 18

Katowice

Sprawdź jak dojechać

Twój zakres obowiązków


Obsługa księgowa systemów bankowych, w tym realizacja dyspozycji księgowych z innych jednostek operacyjnych.
Weryfikacja prawidłowości księgowań w systemach bankowych.
Wykonywanie zadań związanych z zamknięciem miesiąca i roku w systemie księgowym.
Samodzielne przygotowywanie i analiza raportów okresowych i doraźnych z danych księgowych (bezpośrednia współpraca z Hurtownią Danych, Departamentem Informacji Zarządczej i IT).
Udział w projektach dotyczących wdrożenia nowych produktów od strony księgowej.
Tworzenie, wprowadzanie oraz testowanie nowych rozwiązań prowadzących do optymalizacji procesów księgowych w Zespole.


Nasze wymagania


Gotowość do pracy na pół etatu.
Preferowane wykształcenie kierunkowe (rachunkowość, bankowość, finanse, ekonomia).
Znajomość zagadnień z dziedziny rachunkowości.
Biegła znajomość obsługi komputera, w tym MS Excel na poziomie zaawansowanym.
Umiejętność analitycznego myślenia i wyciągania wniosków.
Samodzielność w rozwiązywaniu problemów.

Zapraszamy Cię do świata bardziej velo, w którym kierujemy się otwartością, przedsiębiorczością, rzetelnością a także zaufaniem.
Wartości te wspierają nas w budowaniu dynamicznej instytucji finansowej, która kładzie nacisk na innowacyjnej obsłudze klienta i dostarczaniu wyjątkowych rozwiązań finansowych. Jesteśmy pionierem w wykorzystywaniu najnowszych technologii. Dzięki podejściu eXtreme Agile, VeloBank jest w stanie szybko reagować na zmieniające się potrzeby klientów i dynamiczne warunki rynkowe. Wykorzystanie sztucznej inteligencji pozwala nam na personalizację obsługi klienta, analizę dużych zbiorów danych oraz automatyzację procesów, co przekłada się na szybsze i bardziej efektywne działanie.
Współpraca z VeloBank to nie tylko gwarancja profesjonalizmu i bezpieczeństwa, ale także dostęp do najnowocześniejszych technologii, które sprzyjają osiągnieciu celów finansowych i sukcesów biznesowych.
VeloTeam to ponad 3000 osób, które na co dzień pracują w centralach w: Warszawie, Łodzi, Katowicach, Wrocławiu, Jastrzębiu Zdrój oraz w oddziałach zlokalizowanych w całej Polsce.
Dołącz do nas i miej wpływ na tworzenie Świata Bardziej Velo! 😊

Twój zakres obowiązków

  • Weryfikacja prawidłowości księgowań w systemach bankowych.
  • Wykonywanie zadań związanych z zamknięciem miesiąca i roku w systemie księgowym.
  • Samodzielne przygotowywanie i analiza raportów okresowych i doraźnych z danych księgowych (bezpośrednia współpraca z Hurtownią Danych, Departamentem Informacji Zarządczej i IT).
  • Udział w projektach dotyczących wdrożenia nowych produktów od strony księgowej.
  • Tworzenie, wprowadzanie oraz testowanie nowych rozwiązań prowadzących do optymalizacji procesów księgowych w Zespole.

Title: CAP DE BARRA
Description:
**Estem creixent i busquem talent!**

Si tens experiència en hostaleria i restauració, parles diversos idiomes, t'apassiona la gastronomia i gaudeixes oferint un servei excel·lent, t'oferim una oportunitat única per desenvolupar la teva carrera en un entorn dinàmic i en creixement constant.

Què Oferim

Bon salari i condicions competitives.

Creixement professional: Formació contínua i oportunitats de promoció dins l'empresa.

Ubicació: Centre de treball a EMPURIABRAVA, amb un ambient de treball positiu i col·laboratiu.


El perfil que busquem**:


Experiència mínima d'1-2 anys en servei de sala o barra en un restaurant.

Experiència en l'elaboració de còctels, barra i atenció al client .

Passió pel servei al client i per oferir una experiència gastronòmica excel·lent.

Capacitat de treballar en equip, mantenint l'ordre i la neteja en tot moment.

Orientació a l'excel·lència i al detall, seguint els procediments establerts.

Ganes de crèixer a l’empresa com a treballador/a TXOTS.

Les Teves Funcions

🍹 Preparar i servir begudes amb qualitat.

👥 Coordinar l’equip de barra.

🧽 Mantenir neta i ordenada la barra.


Què esperem de tu?**


Compromís amb l'excel·lència i la millora contínua.

Capacitat per treballar sota pressió i en equip.

Proactivitat i iniciativa per oferir un servei de qualitat.

Si creus que tens el que busquem i vols formar part d'un equip en expansió, no dubtis inscriu-t’hi a l’oferta.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Enterprise Data Management team is a nimble, cross-functional group that thrives on solving complex data challenges. We manage enterprise data assets, engineer scalable reporting solutions, and deliver actionable insights that inform strategic decisions across the bank.

We’re seeking a Data Analyst with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for coding—someone who can bridge the gap between raw data and business intelligence. This role offers the opportunity to work with modern data stacks and contribute to the evolution of our data infrastructure.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Analysis & Insights Generation (30%)


Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) and statistical profiling using Python (leveraging libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy) and Java for backend data processing tasks
Develop reusable scripts and modular code for data wrangling, anomaly detection, and KPI tracking
Apply object-oriented programming principles to build scalable data pipelines and analytical utilities


Data Visualization & Reporting (40%)


Design and implement interactive dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or custom-built web interfaces
Utilize DAX, Power Query, and Salesforce APIs to integrate disparate data sources into unified reporting layers
Translate complex datasets into intuitive visual narratives that support executive decision-making


Data Extraction & Preparation (40%)


Build and maintain ETL workflows using Python, Java, and SQL-based tools to extract data from PostgreSQL, MSSQL, and cloud-based data lakes
Automate data cleansing and transformation routines using Apache POI (for Excel automation in Java), VBA, and Power Query
Ensure data integrity through rigorous validation, schema enforcement, and exception handling


QUALIFICATIONS:


2+ years of experience in data analysis, software development, or business intelligence, preferably in financial services or a regulated industry
Proficiency in Python and Java, with experience in data manipulation, automation, and backend integration
Strong SQL skills and familiarity with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MSSQL)
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau) and dashboard development
Familiarity with ETL processes, data modeling, and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Experience with Excel (including Power Query and VBA), and process documentation tools (Visio, Lucidchart)
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field
High proficiency in technical writing and documentation


NICE TO HAVES (Or Things You'll Get To Learn):


Experience with DuckDB, Polars, or other high-performance analytical engines
Exposure to cloud data platforms like AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, or Google BigQuery
Familiarity with Git for version control and collaborative development
Interest in machine learning, predictive modeling, or statistical inference


About Northern Bank & Trust Company

Northern Bank is a full-service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers live their lives and grow their businesses. From deposit products to loans to payment and collections services, we work hands-on with our entrepreneurial customers, both locally and across the country, to provide the financial support they need to realize their personal and business goals. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of over $3 billion with 12 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on Facebook (/NorthernBankM A/), Twitter (@northernbankma), Instagram (@northernbankma) and LinkedIn (company/northern-bank-ma/).

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, Client Services

About 4mativ Technologies, Inc.

4MATIV Technologies manages multi-modal mobility for school systems nationwide with technology to expand options and enhance service. We envision a future where all children have access to the learning opportunities that maximize their potential, and we are reimagining transportation to accelerate student outcomes.

We partner with schools to improve service, safety, and holistic sustainability, ensuring all students have access to the right ride. Currently, we manage transportation for over 50 school districts across cities including Houston, Indianapolis, Minneapolis-St. Paul, and Phoenix, simplifying operations and expanding services for families. Every school day, 4MATIV manages outsourced vendors and operates a contact center supporting more than 22,000 student trips across over 1,000 routes for schools across the country.

Our Client Services team provides tailored advisory and analysis services. 4MATIV works hand in hand with education organizations to design flexible, local solutions that meet the needs of every learner. We partner with school districts to optimize transportation systems, identify efficiencies, and design lasting solutions. We support some of the nation's largest public school districts and charter organizations as trusted mobility advisors. Our projects aim to enhance client understanding and empower them to drive meaningful system improvements. Data-driven insights are at the core of our work, using advanced analysis and tools to set us apart in the industry.

Our team is committed to:


Working shoulder-to-shoulder with our clients as a mission-aligned and trusted partner
Valuing diversity of perspectives and experiences
Care for every detail and outcome
Constant learning and improvement


Position Overview

4MATIV is a rapidly growing company with an increasingly broad portfolio of consulting clients. As our list of client districts and state education agencies grows, the need for a robust, productive, and knowledgeable team of analysts is increasingly important to our business. This key member to our growing team will have the ability to contribute greatly to the direction and operation of this team and business function. We're looking for someone that is enthusiastic, willing to bring new ideas, and looking to learn and grow alongside the company.

The Data Analyst will play a key role in crafting intuitive, insightful, and rigorous analyses that inspire and guide our clients to implement new student mobility innovations. The ideal candidate is a quick learner, is self-motivated, is analytically gifted, has a drive for creative optimization, and can manage data processes from beginning to end. The candidate will be able to handle a variety of analytical tasks including but not limited to: descriptive analysis of student transportation system performance and configuration, geospatial analysis and visualization of students/schools/terminals, estimation of the impact of different changes to system configuration and optimization (in terms of costs, efficiency, and emissions), and data pipelining. While our team utilizes standardized templates, reusable code, and documented analytic processes, client data is frequently incomplete; this role requires someone who is flexible, innovative, able to make smart assumptions, and capable of leveraging proxy variables in order to produce useful analysis.

Responsibilities


Lead assigned analysis projects from start to finish, delivering results on time while collaborating effectively with colleagues on resources and timelines
Perform in-depth data analysis with self-direction and accuracy, building models to optimize transportation operations and enhance efficiency for school systems
Develop and run reusable Python scripts to automate processes and conduct data analysis
Deploy clear commenting and process documentation to ensure the code is decipherable and usable by other staff members.
Create and maintain Excel, Google Sheets and other models for consultative projects and or internal operational use.
Use business knowledge, code scripts, and software processes to clean, spot-check, and prepare data from various sources.
Continuously enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of technical task and project delivery, ensuring streamlined processes and minimizing any operational bottlenecks.
Ensure the accuracy and reliability of technical deliverables through application of rigorous quality control measures and review processes.
Integrate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and accessibility across systems
Summarize, visualize, and present findings to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner
Leverage GIS software to produce informative and actionable maps and geospatial insights for both client-facing and internal projects.
Communicate methodologies, assumptions, results, and the significance of analyses through clear written reports and presentations
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand client needs and challenges, translating these into actionable data insights to guide decision-making and strategic initiatives
Uphold and contribute to the continuous improvement of company code documentation standards and data governance policies, ensuring data quality, privacy, and security


Requirements

The candidate should have education and/or experience working with large sets of data in an analytical capacity. The candidate should be detail-oriented and self-motivated in order to drive business processes to completion. The requirements for this position are:

Education and Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
Two (2) years of analytic experience in a relevant field
Experience in data operations in transportation, logistics, or K-12 Education preferred


Technical Skills:


Proficiency in Python & SQL
Proficiency working with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
Proficiency working with APIs
Experience with GIS software


Core Competencies:


User-focus: Maintains consistent focus on the overarching purpose of analyses, ensuring analyses meet user needs while considering the user experience and perspective.
Self-motivation: Takes initiative, working independently with minimal supervision, setting clear goals, and driving progress. Demonstrated ability to exceed goals and have a bottom-line, action focused orientation
Problem-solving: Tackles complex data projects with persistence, creativity, and a strong curiosity to find innovative solutions
Attention to details: Effectively manages multiple tasks, prioritizing work to deliver thorough, error-free results on-time
Effective communication: Exhibits strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to engage diverse stakeholders clearly and professionally. High capacity for leading and partnering with people cross-functionally in a collaborative environment


Benefits

Salary Range: $85,000 - $100,000, per year

Benefits:


401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Vision insurance
Show more

While our team utilizes standardized templates, reusable code, and documented analytic processes, client data is frequently incomplete; this role requires someone who is flexible, innovative, able to make smart assumptions, and capable of leveraging proxy variables in order to produce useful analysis.

Responsibilities

  • Lead assigned analysis projects from start to finish, delivering results on time while collaborating effectively with colleagues on resources and timelines
  • Perform in-depth data analysis with self-direction and accuracy, building models to optimize transportation operations and enhance efficiency for school systems
  • Develop and run reusable Python scripts to automate processes and conduct data analysis
  • Deploy clear commenting and process documentation to ensure the code is decipherable and usable by other staff members.
  • Create and maintain Excel, Google Sheets and other models for consultative projects and or internal operational use.
  • Use business knowledge, code scripts, and software processes to clean, spot-check, and prepare data from various sources.
  • Continuously enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of technical task and project delivery, ensuring streamlined processes and minimizing any operational bottlenecks.
  • Ensure the accuracy and reliability of technical deliverables through application of rigorous quality control measures and review processes.
  • Integrate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and accessibility across systems
  • Summarize, visualize, and present findings to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner
  • Leverage GIS software to produce informative and actionable maps and geospatial insights for both client-facing and internal projects.
  • Communicate methodologies, assumptions, results, and the significance of analyses through clear written reports and presentations
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand client needs and challenges, translating these into actionable data insights to guide decision-making and strategic initiatives
  • Uphold and contribute to the continuous improvement of company code documentation standards and data governance policies, ensuring data quality, privacy, and security

Requirements

The candidate should have education and/or experience working with large sets of data in an analytical capacity. The candidate should be detail-oriented and self-motivated in order to drive business processes to completion. The requirements for this position are:

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
  • Two (2) years of analytic experience in a relevant field
  • Experience in data operations in transportation, logistics, or K-12 Education preferred

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Python & SQL
  • Proficiency working with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
  • Proficiency working with APIs
  • Experience with GIS software

Core Competencies:

  • User-focus: Maintains consistent focus on the overarching purpose of analyses, ensuring analyses meet user needs while considering the user experience and perspective.
  • Self-motivation: Takes initiative, working independently with minimal supervision, setting clear goals, and driving progress. Demonstrated ability to exceed goals and have a bottom-line, action focused orientation
  • Problem-solving: Tackles complex data projects with persistence, creativity, and a strong curiosity to find innovative solutions
  • Attention to details: Effectively manages multiple tasks, prioritizing work to deliver thorough, error-free results on-time
  • Effective communication: Exhibits strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to engage diverse stakeholders clearly and professionally. High capacity for leading and partnering with people cross-functionally in a collaborative environment

Benefits

Salary Range: $85,000 - $100,000, per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Vision insurance

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL
